abstract.para: We think it is essential to define sub-projects within Uludag to exploit parallel development and concurrent engineering methodologies. We prefer to do this by dividing Uludag into three layers.

sect1.title: Core Layer
sect1.para:
This is the software packages and their connection to the system, which is sine qua non of Uludag, or any distribution.
Packages Projects: Adapting the software packaging and preparing them for distribution. Package Management System Project: The configuration tool that handles the installation and management of application packages. Configuration Tools Project: The framework and the tools that takes care of configuration of the operating system and important applications. Installer Project: The software that installs the operating system onto a brand new or in use system.

sect1.title: Presentation Layer
sect1.para:
The components that Uludag use to interface with the user.
Turkish Project: Translating the operating system and the applications to Turkish, and guaranteeing that the Turkish characters and fonts work flawlessly. Graphics & Media Project: Designing all visual and audio components of the desktop and the documents. Human-Computer Interaction Project: Developing all Uludag projects through a human-centric design approach and obeying the usability criteria.

sect1.title: Auxiliary Layer
sect1.para:
The components which are not necessary per se, nevertheless of utmost importance for sustainability of Uludag.
Quality Assurance Project: Defining, documenting and monitoring all the production processes of Uludag. Contributor Relations Project: Managing the relations with the developers who are volunteer to contribute to Uludag project. Developer System Project: Designing, deploying and managing the infrastructure that will be employed by all Uludag projects.
